title: Warner Channel, Facebook partner for Emmys' social TV across LATAM
text:
Juan Fernandez Gonzalez | 22 September 2015 
Facebook's social TV tool Mentions Box has been employed by Warner Channel throughout Latin America to boost engagement around the live broadcast of the Emmy Awards. 
Through the tool, viewers were able to comment on the event and ask TV stars about the gala. During the week prior to the Awards, actors and actress were videoed answering these questions and this content was unblocked on Warner Channel's Facebook page during the event. 
Designed by iStrategyLabs for Facebook, Mentions Box aims to connect audiences and celebrities to social TV and online video. 
"We look to deliver relevant content to our audience, and this time we also offered a high interactive experience," said Gerard Kerik, VP, brand strategy, Turner Broadcasting Systems Latin America. "Emmys are reference awards for the industry, and therefore are the perfect occasion to launch this Facebook technology across the Latin American region." 
"We have brought Mentions Box to the Emmys' red carpet for the first time and we have offered Latin Americans a real chance to interact with the celebrities," added Julieta Shama, strategic media partnerships South Cone, Facebook . 
In addition to enabling a new social TV feature, Warner Channel also deployed live broadcast from the Microsoft Theatre in Los Angeles, covering the event in which Game of Thrones was awarded 12 Emmys.
